commit_message:
Oslo: Adjust content layout to be more readable

Put common information at the beginning of the file, like:
" launchpad: xxx
  team: oslo
  type: library
  release-model: cycle-with-intermediary
  send-announcements-to: openstack-dev@lists.openstack.org
  include-pypi-link: true
"
this make it more readable.

Change-Id: I41855916a4b0f6af565a296753886069daf3e18a

commit_message:
Add testing and debugging documentation

This change adds a testing and debugging documentation page. Note that
it is only a start, and it is expected that this document will evolve
and be expanded over time.

Change-Id: I26a08db463191f85c7c5eb1b6848f651c93487fb
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/dragonflow refs/changes/03/395603/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: ===================== Testing and Debugging ===================== This page discusses the testing and debugging capabilities that come with dragonflow. Testing ======= After installing with devstack, there are a few tests that can be ran to verify Dragonflow was installed correctly. Fullstack tests --------------- The fullstack tests execute Neutron API commands, and then verifies the pipeline. This is done by creating relevant ports, simulating a plug-vif event, and then passing packets on these ports. The tests verify that packets are received if and only if they are supposed to, and that any necessary modification is done, e.g. replacing L2 addresses in L3 routing. To run the tests: :: > tox -e fullstack Debugging ========= There are a few tools that exist to debug Dragonflow. Most of them are geared towards verifying the pipeline was installed correctly. :: > sudo ovs-ofctl dump-flows br-int This command will display the pipline that has been installed in OVS. See the manual page for ovs-ofctl for more info. It is worthwhile to note that each flow contains statistics such as how many packets matched this flow, and what is the cummulative size. :: > sudo ovs-appctl ofproto/trace br-int <flow> This command will simulate a packet matching the given flow through the pipline. The perl script in [#]_ can be used to facilitate the use of this tool. The script also recirculates the packet when necessary, e.g. for connection tracking. .. [#] https://gist.github.com/omeranson/5c731955edcf0517bfb0ce0ce511cc9b

commit_message:
Using oslo_log instead of logging

The oslo.log (logging) configuration library provides standardized
configuration for all openstack projects. It also provides custom
formatters, handlers and support for context specific
logging (like resource id's etc).

It is better to use the common logging module.

Change-Id: I9809891eb72becd0215def2abce7695dcd949aed

commit_message:
Blacklist rtslib-fb 2.1.60/61

These have an unconditional dep on pyudev without declaring it, causing
test failures. PR with fix submitted:
  https://github.com/open-iscsi/rtslib-fb/pull/81

Change-Id: Ib1256be6f3c74256eda5766ec92de85ad7f44aa6
(cherry picked from commit f76b268a091ea279e91658fe0b8cad6c912aa76c)
Conflicts:
	global-requirements.txt

commit_message:
Add Apache 2.0 license to source file

As per OpenStack licensing guide lines [1]:
[H102 H103] Newly contributed Source Code should be licensed under
the Apache 2.0 license.
[H104] Files with no code shouldn't contain any license header nor
comments, and must be left completely empty.

[1] http://docs.openstack.org/developer/hacking/#openstack-licensing

Change-Id: I84f5c0ef956b7402b73f208fcf9ce6cfa227777c
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/ceilometer refs/changes/77/395477/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Use apt_repository update_cache feature

With ansible 2.2, apt_repository update_cache feature has
been fixed. When a new repo will be added, apt-get update
will be run after the addition if update_cache is set to yes.

This combined with the apt module now properly checking the
cache validity, we can now have proper updating of the cache
with registering variables.

Change-Id: Id93d790ceb7695bdbdcafab8396faf1ecc423039

commit_message:
Move optional plugin installs out of the venv

The optionally enabled plugins do not need to be included in the
neutron venv, but should be added to the venv when enabled.

This prevents clashes between plugins and unnecessary db
migrations, including migrations which may not be working due to
changes in neutron core which haven't been applied to the plugin
yet.

Combined backport of:
- https://review.openstack.org/395556
- https://review.openstack.org/395570

Related-Bug: #1640319
Change-Id: I7dcab3f3d56118b93b9a5d74065234acb620ae22
(cherry picked from commit d4dd9df137877756507a5fcfa033d94f0f743429)

commit_message:
Fix freezer CLI output

There is a problem with executing CLI commands:
no endpoint type was provided during creating keystone
client object. This patch fixes it.
Also, there are some small changes:
* moving from keystoneclient to keystoneauth1
* fixed import order, replaced import objects
* supressed output from requests lib due to info messages in output
(Starting new HTTP connection (1))

Change-Id: I57c42877c94d6d5706a7b6bf1e154f29704f9783
Signed-off-by: Ruslan Aliev <raliev@mirantis.com>

subject: Fix external_endpoints when no vip in use
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-11-10 10:03:37.000000000', 'files': ['charms_openstack/adapters.py', 'unit_tests/test_charms_openstack_adapters.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/charms.openstack/commit/8d648cc356ceb24dd4b00e5b8604c9496c12d552', 'message': "Fix external_endpoints when no vip in use

When the config setting 'vip' has not been set the 'vip' attribute
of APIConfigurationAdapter is None. In that case...

ip = getattr(self, 'vip', self.local_address)

... sets 'ip' to None since 'vip' is a valid attribute of the class.
However, the correct behaviour is to return self.local_address
since vip is not in use.

Change-Id: Ibb30be8acc4a3f664222170eb2e36fefbf6adda1
Closes-Bug: 1640393
"}]
commit_message:
Fix external_endpoints when no vip in use

When the config setting 'vip' has not been set the 'vip' attribute
of APIConfigurationAdapter is None. In that case...

ip = getattr(self, 'vip', self.local_address)

... sets 'ip' to None since 'vip' is a valid attribute of the class.
However, the correct behaviour is to return self.local_address
since vip is not in use.

Change-Id: Ibb30be8acc4a3f664222170eb2e36fefbf6adda1
Closes-Bug: 1640393

commit_message:
pci: Validate device name

Per the documentation:

    The devname can be a valid PCI device name. The only device names
    that are supported are those displayed by the Linux utility
    ifconfig -a and correspond to either a PF or a VF on a vNIC"

Actually validate this.

In addition, rename an exception to more correctly represent its
implication.

Change-Id: I123fc2305c20987da3a507ab5ac027786e226dd4
Closes-bug: #1466451
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/10/395710/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

subject: Block kombu 4.0.0
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-11-09 14:43:29.000000000', 'files': ['global-requirements.txt'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/requirements/commit/244aaae29947b351185d9d2d34f31ced37ad8a5a', 'message': "Block kombu 4.0.0

oslo.messaging is not compatible with it, for two reasons: because we
cap amqp<2.0.0 there; and because the code of the library needs some
adjustments.

Until we clear that up, we will block the new  kombu release. We don't
cap because it's against the direction we want to take long term
(adopting to new upstream releases).

Change-Id: I34e0ca49966d679ff60d4bcfbf7157c6289a9aef
Related-Bug: #1638263
(cherry picked from commit 68d10af6e1c11c818b4419a466cb6e0b9c060a55)
"}]
commit_message:
Block kombu 4.0.0

oslo.messaging is not compatible with it, for two reasons: because we
cap amqp<2.0.0 there; and because the code of the library needs some
adjustments.

Until we clear that up, we will block the new  kombu release. We don't
cap because it's against the direction we want to take long term
(adopting to new upstream releases).

Change-Id: I34e0ca49966d679ff60d4bcfbf7157c6289a9aef
Related-Bug: #1638263
(cherry picked from commit 68d10af6e1c11c818b4419a466cb6e0b9c060a55)

commit_message:
Add metrics/dimensions/names into monasca-api

This endpoint will return all the dimension names for a given metric
name.
Added dimension-names for influx in python api and java api
Added dimension-names for vertica in java api

Depends-On: Id981dafd00778a6d4a376b9ceab011231e94c0c6
Change-Id: I0192ccb9276ea94103a477bd2ad7d10f21e64d31
Implements: blueprint dimensions-api

subject: Use haproxy_bind as override
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-11-09 18:18:46.000000000', 'files': ['templates/service.j2', 'releasenotes/notes/haproxy-bind-override-9562bab32b964de2.yaml'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible-haproxy_server/commit/8664f7d8024a59f11a723b7b87a79b9f573153ce', 'message': 'Use haproxy_bind as override

Haproxy currently forces the binding of external_lb_vip_address
and allows appending additional VIPs such as extra binds and the
internal LB vip. Setting an haproxy_bind list on the service definition
should override, not append, the _bind vips to the service. The service
template offers plenty of other options for appending VIPs.

Change-Id: I2f704e0d36026850857dbb3b9ddee4f64bc07432
(cherry picked from commit d7cc047f8d922377d78463ad9e625411d6460ea9)

commit_message:
Use haproxy_bind as override

Haproxy currently forces the binding of external_lb_vip_address
and allows appending additional VIPs such as extra binds and the
internal LB vip. Setting an haproxy_bind list on the service definition
should override, not append, the _bind vips to the service. The service
template offers plenty of other options for appending VIPs.

Change-Id: I2f704e0d36026850857dbb3b9ddee4f64bc07432
(cherry picked from commit d7cc047f8d922377d78463ad9e625411d6460ea9)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible-haproxy_server refs/changes/50/395750/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: --- fixes: - Setting the haproxy_bind list on a service is now used as an override to the other VIPs defined in the environment. Previously it was being treated as an append to the other VIPs so there was no path to override the VIP binds for a service. For example, haproxy_bind could be used to bind a service to the internal VIP only.

commit_message:
Update ansible-lint to 3.4.1

This patch updates all playbooks to ensure compliance
with ansible-lint 3.4.1 and also implements updates
to the distro/pip package install tasks to ensure
that they use the appropriate variables designed for
setting state.

Additionally the utility playbook is set to use upper
constraints when installing packages.

Change-Id: I534388930317daf370cf6c943d62d1e50184ead9

commit_message:
Remove join filter from pip module tasks

Ansible 2.2 now treats the 'name' argument for the pip module
as a list, removing the need for us to implement the join
filter to optimise the install execution.

Change-Id: I7c64cb96e65ba4c858268847de6abef5377e44eb

commit_message:
Update to hacking 0.12.0 and use new checks

Use hacking 0.12.0

Use the new checks that are available:
    [H106] Dont put vim configuration in source files.
    [H203] Use assertIs(Not)None to check for None.
    [H904] Delay string interpolations at logging calls.

No changes were needed to the code to pass the new checks.

Change-Id: I348a9ef60449fc3d5981013f0be3bfd66d503f6e
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-ironicclient refs/changes/88/395588/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # [H106] Dont put vim configuration in source files. # [H203] Use assertIs(Not)None to check for None. # [H904] Delay string interpolations at logging calls. enable-extensions=H106,H203,H904

commit_message:
Use updated get_url module checksum functionality

Starting in Ansible 2.0, the get_url [1] module provides the
ability for a checksum to be provided to the get_url module
which will be verified against the local destination file
and the task skipped if it matches.

[1] http://docs.ansible.com/ansible/get_url_module.html

This patch implements the use of this functionality.

The ability to ignore a venv download failure is also removed
as this is not necessary or desirable. It is better for the
download to fail and the playbook execution to stop immediately
so that the failure point is exposed.

Change-Id: I0852b5319651b36b233bf0f2d425526743444052
(cherry picked from commit 42904c451d9cd59012b661606077b76861fa054c)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible-os_nova refs/changes/00/395700/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
[WIP] Horizon dashboard for tap-as-a-service

This is an implementation of a dashboard discussed on ML[1][2].
* Network topology view is based on kilo[3].
* Tap service panel is added to Horizon dashboard.
* Command options provided on CLI are supported.

[1] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2016-March/088735.html
[2] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2016-March/089330.html
[3] https://www.openstack.org/software/kilo/

Change-Id: Ica7e02f84cc2e6303d19b30541ea956894465389
Co-Authored-By: Soichi Shigeta <shigeta.soichi@jp.fujitsu.com>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tap-as-a-service refs/changes/83/300383/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Enable Swift account_quotas middleware by default

Operators might want to restrict unlimited growth for their users,
therefore enabling the account_quotas middleware by default (it's
already included in puppet-swift since some time).

Change-Id: I0761c476b8e39023fdbd1832a3a35184d90e5c9f

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-11-09 16:26:35.000000000', 'files': ['tasks/tempest_install.yml'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible-os_tempest/commit/977b60e115d89ff3db9c78a702ad5636bdf545ed', 'message': 'Use updated get_url module checksum functionality

Starting in Ansible 2.0, the get_url [1] module provides the
ability for a checksum to be provided to the get_url module
which will be verified against the local destination file
and the task skipped if it matches.

[1] http://docs.ansible.com/ansible/get_url_module.html

This patch implements the use of this functionality.

The ability to ignore a venv download failure is also removed
as this is not necessary or desirable. It is better for the

so that the failure point is exposed.

Change-Id: Ibe3004fcd2c7ede7a23f6cd254c8f539b4f3f9f1
(cherry picked from commit a38aaea1cb36bc36bfb7292e5df79393b09f7839)
'}]
commit_message:
Use updated get_url module checksum functionality

Starting in Ansible 2.0, the get_url [1] module provides the
ability for a checksum to be provided to the get_url module
which will be verified against the local destination file
and the task skipped if it matches.

[1] http://docs.ansible.com/ansible/get_url_module.html

This patch implements the use of this functionality.

The ability to ignore a venv download failure is also removed
as this is not necessary or desirable. It is better for the
download to fail and the playbook execution to stop immediately
so that the failure point is exposed.

Change-Id: Ibe3004fcd2c7ede7a23f6cd254c8f539b4f3f9f1
(cherry picked from commit a38aaea1cb36bc36bfb7292e5df79393b09f7839)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible-os_tempest refs/changes/01/395701/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: checksum: "sha1:{{ lookup('url', tempest_venv_download_url | replace('tgz', 'checksum')) }}" when: not tempest_developer_mode | bool when: tempest_developer_mode | bool - tempest_get_venv | changed or tempest_venv_dir | changed
deleted_lines: - name: Get local venv checksum stat: path: "/var/cache/{{ tempest_venv_download_url | basename }}" get_md5: False when: not tempest_developer_mode | bool register: local_venv_stat - name: Get remote venv checksum uri: url: "{{ tempest_venv_download_url | replace('tgz', 'checksum') }}" return_content: True when: not tempest_developer_mode | bool register: remote_venv_checksum # TODO: When project moves to ansible 2 we can pass this a sha256sum which will: # a) allow us to remove force: yes # b) allow the module to calculate the checksum of dest file which would # result in file being downloaded only if provided and dest sha256sum # checksums differ force: yes failed_when: false when: - not tempest_developer_mode | bool - (local_venv_stat.stat.exists == False or {{ local_venv_stat.stat.checksum is defined and local_venv_stat.stat.checksum != remote_venv_checksum.content | trim }}) when: tempest_get_venv | failed or tempest_developer_mode | bool - tempest_get_venv | success

commit_message:
Disable SSLv3

Add the 'ssl-default-bind-options no-sslv3' option to the
configuration file so that SSLv3 is not enabled.

Change-Id: I2d06189e61064d9af10bea1091fba31163331379
Closes-Bug: 1640560
(cherry picked from commit 1716a7070341dbef6436f27709d18f07cf75e65f)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible-haproxy_server refs/changes/11/395811/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: {% if haproxy_ssl | bool %} ssl-default-bind-options no-sslv3 tune.ssl.default-dh-param {{haproxy_ssl_dh_param}} {% endif %}

commit_message:
Raise a specific exception instead of generic AttributeError

Currently we raise an AttributeError when expected attribute is missing
from the response. This is not very developer-friendly, so this patch
creates a new exception (derived from AttributeError for compatibility)
for this purpose.

Change-Id: If2ac03dcd410d451dc7bbfe7bbd0b145da201c9a
Related-Bug: #1550328
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-dracclient refs/changes/66/394466/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Raise a reasonable error on non-nullable flags with empty text

Now it fails with AttributeError: 'NoneType' object has no attribute 'strip'.
Raise a new exception with proper explanation instead.

Partial-Bug: #1550328
Change-Id: Ie9f9d212c934bb75e8224dd64ec8df7f788b86d3
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-dracclient refs/changes/65/394465/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: from dracclient import exceptions :raises: DRACEmptyResponseField if the attribute is present in the XML doc but it has no text and nullable is False. if item.text is None: raise exceptions.DRACEmptyResponseField(attr=attr_name)

commit_message:
Fix JUnit reporter for Intern

Its setup should not depend on FAIL_FAST env variable,
which is responsible for stopping of tests only.

Also, xml file should be saved in the same location as other artifacts
like screenshots.

Change-Id: I18c6ec64906aa5b8dea39a0a837389875ddd6b3e
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/fuel-ui refs/changes/67/395567/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

deleted_lines: class NodeTag(Base): __tablename__ = 'node_tags' # NOTE(rmoe): This is required to satisfy some tests. commit_message:
Defaults kernel.pid_max to 1048576

In some scenarios we reach the kernel.pid_max value, this change
adds a parameter to the Kernel service for configuration of the
sysctl key and defaults it to 1048576.

Change-Id: Id8f3e6b7ed9846022898d7158fe9180418847085
Closes-Bug: #1639191
(cherry picked from commit 69be131d4075e5347b18c342b4de4fb503de39a5)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates refs/changes/08/395608/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: KernelPidMax: default: 1048576 description: Configures sysctl kernel.pid_max key type: number kernel.pid_max: value: {get_param: KernelPidMax}

commit_message:
Remove join filter from pip module tasks

Ansible 2.2 now treats the 'name' argument for the pip module
as a list, removing the need for us to implement the join
filter to optimise the install execution.

Change-Id: I57d8e2852bd9144e04d614b567222b6950563d92
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible-os_watcher refs/changes/38/395838/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Use updated get_url module checksum functionality

Starting in Ansible 2.0, the get_url [1] module provides the
ability for a checksum to be provided to the get_url module
which will be verified against the local destination file
and the task skipped if it matches.

[1] http://docs.ansible.com/ansible/get_url_module.html

This patch implements the use of this functionality.

The ability to ignore a venv download failure is also removed
as this is not necessary or desirable. It is better for the
download to fail and the playbook execution to stop immediately
so that the failure point is exposed.

Change-Id: I22304c2d6b019fae8e4234548c3811cb8b1eb02f
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible-os_watcher refs/changes/14/394414/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

Preparing this role for the ansible-lint version bump

commit_message:
Use ansible_service_mgr fact

This patch removes some extra tasks for detecting systemd and uses
the `ansible_service_mgr` fact instead.

Partial-Bug: #1640125
Change-Id: I4c35f5e92ea9ba4ed297c683aa4e8ebdcbe3fb4e

commit_message:
Add networking-bagpipe to global-requirements.txt

We recently enabled the requirements proposal bot on networking-bgpvpn [1],
but the bot is failing because one of the requirements (networking-bagpipe>=5.0.0)
is not in global-requirements.txt.

This change adds networking-bagpipe>=5.0.0 to global-requirements and
upper-constraints.txt to address this issue.

[1] Iae97804c5bb019132d040002b6da5235a200b647

Change-Id: I948d2e967f62f690f412a7e50d76f54cf4fe262e

commit_message:
Fix several errors in LLDP handling code

* Stop silencing exceptions in raw socket context manager
* Correctly handle receiving packages with odd size and too small ones
* Fix a unit test that was testing nothing due to bad mocking

Change-Id: Ic8626d10618f52d50667d2698f34a92f5dcac33e
Closes-Bug: #1640238
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/ironic-python-agent refs/changes/32/395632/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: @mock.patch('select.select') @mock.patch('socket.socket') def test_get_lldp_info_malformed(self, sock_mock, select_mock, fcntl_mock): expected_lldp = { 'eth1': [], 'eth0': [], } interface_names = ['eth0', 'eth1'] sock1 = mock.Mock() sock1.recv.return_value = b'123456789012345' # odd size sock1.fileno.return_value = 4 sock2 = mock.Mock() sock2.recv.return_value = b'1234' # too small sock2.fileno.return_value = 5 sock_mock.side_effect = [sock1, sock2] select_mock.side_effect = [ ([sock1], [], []), ([sock2], [], []), ] lldp_info = netutils.get_lldp_info(interface_names) self.assertEqual(expected_lldp, lldp_info) sock1.bind.assert_called_with(('eth0', netutils.LLDP_ETHERTYPE)) sock2.bind.assert_called_with(('eth1', netutils.LLDP_ETHERTYPE)) sock1.recv.assert_called_with(1600) sock2.recv.assert_called_with(1600) self.assertEqual(1, sock1.close.call_count) self.assertEqual(1, sock2.close.call_count) # 2 interfaces, 2 calls to enter promiscuous mode, 1 to leave self.assertEqual(6, fcntl_mock.call_count) expected_calls = [ mock.call([sock1, sock2], [], [], cfg.CONF.lldp_timeout), mock.call([sock2], [], [], cfg.CONF.lldp_timeout), ] self.assertEqual(expected_calls, select_mock.call_args_list) @mock.patch('fcntl.ioctl') sock2.bind.side_effect = RuntimeError() def _run_with_bind_fail(): with netutils.RawPromiscuousSockets(interfaces, protocol): self.fail('Unreachable code') self.assertRaises(RuntimeError, _run_with_bind_fail) sock1.bind.assert_called_once_with(('eth0', protocol)) sock2.bind.assert_called_once_with(('ens9f1', protocol)) self.assertEqual(6, fcntl_mock.call_count) sock1.close.assert_called_once_with() sock2.close.assert_called_once_with() @mock.patch('fcntl.ioctl') @mock.patch('socket.socket') def test_raw_promiscuous_sockets_exception(self, sock_mock, fcntl_mock): interfaces = ['eth0', 'ens9f1'] protocol = 3 sock1 = mock.Mock() sock2 = mock.Mock() sock_mock.side_effect = [sock1, sock2] def _run_with_exception(): with netutils.RawPromiscuousSockets(interfaces, protocol): raise RuntimeError() self.assertRaises(RuntimeError, _run_with_exception)
deleted_lines: sock_mock.bind.side_effects = [None, Exception] with netutils.RawPromiscuousSockets(interfaces, protocol) as sockets: # Ensure this isn't run self.assertEqual([], sockets)

commit_message:
Added 'goal' ObjectField for Strategy object

In this changeset, I added the "goal" ObjectField which can
either be loaded by setting the new "eager" parameter as True or
not loaded (as before) by setting it to False.
The advantage of introducing this eager parameter is that this way,
we can reduce to a minimum the overhead of DB queries whenever the
related goal is not actually needed.

Partially-Implements: blueprint watcher-versioned-objects
Change-Id: I103c9ed161d2cedf7b43c55f9e095ef66bf44dea

"asc" or "desc`". :param eager: Load object fields if True (Default: False) return [cls._from_db_object(cls(context), obj, eager=eager) def create(self, context=None, eager=False): :param eager: Load object fields if True (Default: False) :returns: A :class:`Strategy` object. self._from_db_object(self, db_strategy, eager=eager) def refresh(self, context=None, eager=False): :param eager: Load object fields if True (Default: False) current = self.__class__.get_by_id( self._context, strategy_id=self.id, eager=eager)

commit_message:
Refactored Watcher objects to use OVO

In this changeset, I modified all existing Watcher objects to now
rely on oslo.versionedobjects as a base.

Change-Id: I3c9b1ca6da529d128743b99020350f28926ea1a2
Partially-Implements: blueprint watcher-versioned-objects
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/watcher refs/changes/65/359065/10 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: from watcher.objects import fields as wfields@base.WatcherObjectRegistry.register class Audit(base.WatcherPersistentObject, base.WatcherObject, base.WatcherObjectDictCompat): 'id': wfields.IntegerField(), 'uuid': wfields.UUIDField(nullable=True), 'audit_type': wfields.StringField(nullable=True), 'state': wfields.StringField(nullable=True), 'deadline': wfields.DateTimeField(nullable=True), 'parameters': wfields.FlexibleDictField(nullable=True), 'interval': wfields.IntegerField(nullable=True), 'goal_id': wfields.IntegerField(nullable=False), 'strategy_id': wfields.IntegerField(nullable=True), 'host_aggregate': wfields.IntegerField(nullable=True), } @base.remotable_classmethod @base.remotable_classmethod @base.remotable_classmethod @base.remotable_classmethod return [cls._from_db_object(cls(context), obj) for obj in db_audits] @base.remotable @base.remotable @base.remotable self.obj_refresh(current) @base.remotable self.state = State.DELETED
deleted_lines: from watcher.objects import utils as obj_utilsclass Audit(base.WatcherObject): 'id': int, 'uuid': obj_utils.str_or_none, 'audit_type': obj_utils.str_or_none, 'state': obj_utils.str_or_none, 'deadline': obj_utils.datetime_or_str_or_none, 'parameters': obj_utils.dict_or_none, 'interval': obj_utils.int_or_none, 'goal_id': obj_utils.int_or_none, 'strategy_id': obj_utils.int_or_none, 'host_aggregate': obj_utils.int_or_none, } @staticmethod def _from_db_object(audit, db_audit): """Converts a database entity to a formal object.""" for field in audit.fields: audit[field] = db_audit[field] audit.obj_reset_changes() return audit @staticmethod def _from_db_object_list(db_objects, cls, context): """Converts a list of database entities to a list of formal objects.""" return \ [Audit._from_db_object(cls(context), obj) for obj in db_objects] @classmethod @classmethod @classmethod @classmethod return Audit._from_db_object_list(db_audits, cls, context) for field in self.fields: if (hasattr(self, base.get_attrname(field)) and self[field] != current[field]): self[field] = current[field] self.state = "DELETED"

commit_message:
Removed deadline, version, extra & host_aggregate

As we are about to version the Watcher objects, we need to make sure
that upcoming model/object modifications are additive in order to
avoid having to bump the major version of the API. Therefore,
this changeset removes 4 unused DB fields that were exposed in their
associated Watcher objects (i.e. AuditTemplate and Audit).

Change-Id: Ifb0783f21cd66db16b31e3c8e376fc9d6c07dea3
Partially-Implements: blueprint watcher-versioned-objects

commit_message:
Install networking-bagpipe test dependency via tox_install/zuul-cloner

Following the discussion in I948d2e967f62f690f412a7e50d76f54cf4fe262e,
it seems that what we should do is rely on tox_install/zuul-cloner to
acquire networking-bagpipe test dependency.

Change-Id: Ib0600040470382bb7f113cb09aa5d1519ea6c9dd

commit_message:
Eager loading on One-to-X foreign keys

In this changeset, I added ORM relationships to the DB models
concerning the already-declared foreign keys.
I also modified the DB query building to now handle a new 'eager'
parameter that, if True, is responsible to also fetch the data
relative to these 'parent' DB entities (no cascading).

Change-Id: Ieea181af9a4b173c54621dcc6c549161f5a35aeb
Partially-Implements: blueprint watcher-versioned-objects

commit_message:
Update nova api.auth tests to work with newer oslo.context

Due to https://review.openstack.org/#/c/357537/ being
deprecated and removed certain tests in nova are now failing.

To make them pass again use the non-deprecated headers
instead.

Change-Id: I4e26c4517235f4320437904801c374d710655670

commit_message:
VXLAN support for OVS-DPDK

* restriction for using DPDK in VXLAN based
  segmentation case was removed
* in case of using VXLAN with DDPDK used 'br-mesh'
  bridge that has configuration as 'br-prv' and
  vendor specific attribute 'vlan_id' was added
  for 'add-br'
* appropriate tests were added

Implements blueprint vxlan-support-for-ovs-dpdk

Change-Id: I1c4978a15df6f851339a346fe6c4812c5427dd29

commit_message:
Removed get_engine() from db/api

This function was deprecated in change
Id38c06aee428200a061c59a984b59b81b24056e3
get_engine() can be called directly with
context_manager.get_legacy_facade().get_engine()

Change-Id: I7ef45c7ced65a3a3746e616c7b796a34b3551d3c
Related-bug: #1520719

commit_message:
Move dispatcher a level up

Dispatcher as it is designed now is used by both collector and
agent-notification, so let's move it level upper. This makes a more flat
hierarchy.

Change-Id: I681bf58f0b26cca22a48e6655db2547e59f9e805

git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/kolla-kubernetes refs/changes/36/395636/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: ========================== Specfications are Advisory ========================== This project is under heavy active development. Specifications in this repository record "streams of thought" rather than a direct set of actions to take. As an example, kolla-ansible looks much different today than then ansible-multi spec. For Kolla old-timers, many know that Kolla in its present form may not have existed without stream of thought recording that occured in that one specification. All specifications in this repository are subject to abandonment in the future if the development team finds it necessary to change course. The single source of truth for development work is recorded in blueprints as specifications are immutable once committed to the repository. Blueprints on the other hand are dynamic and may be changed.

commit_message:
Fix senlin integration test

zaqar-ui installation was enabled in Zaqar devstack plugin
recently. This change breaks Senlin integration test for
zaqar-ui project name is not in $PROJECTS list. This patch
fixes this issue.

Change-Id: Ic96c1ea21bb1f6a6f79316cd38eba344928503e9

commit_message:
Restart swarm infra containers if deleted

Currently a user can accidentally delete swarm infra
conatiners (swarm-manager, swarm-agent). This change is
to restart infra containers if they were deleted/killed.

Change-Id: I4640dfb3dbb4bb6684da86998424936d3128eade
Closes-Bug: #1640312

subject: Better way to ensure keepalived before haproxy.
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-11-09 14:05:03.000000000', 'files': ['manifests/haproxy.pp', 'manifests/keepalived.pp'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/puppet-tripleo/commit/9858a999f3b47bb2c9b048a47675e4c9d0360d72', 'message': "Better way to ensure keepalived before haproxy.

The lastest patchset of https://review.openstack.org/393361 was actually
not working.

The `if defined` idiom depends on *evaluation* order.

At the time it's red in the haproxy.pp class, the line that loads the
class 'haproxy' has still not yet been reached and thus the `defined`
result is false. The constraint is not added.

For this reason, the use of `defined` in module is not advised by
puppetlabs[1].

[1] https://docs.puppet.com/puppet/latest/reference/function.html#defined

Change-Id: Ibd352cb313f8863d62db8987419378bed5b87256
Relates-To: #1638029
(cherry picked from commit b11d048e55fc20a90bcf11eed0f4cea5e1b45f7c)
"}]
commit_message:
Better way to ensure keepalived before haproxy.

The lastest patchset of https://review.openstack.org/393361 was actually
not working.

The `if defined` idiom depends on *evaluation* order.

At the time it's red in the haproxy.pp class, the line that loads the
class 'haproxy' has still not yet been reached and thus the `defined`
result is false. The constraint is not added.

For this reason, the use of `defined` in module is not advised by
puppetlabs[1].

[1] https://docs.puppet.com/puppet/latest/reference/function.html#defined

Change-Id: Ibd352cb313f8863d62db8987419378bed5b87256
Relates-To: #1638029
(cherry picked from commit b11d048e55fc20a90bcf11eed0f4cea5e1b45f7c)

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-09-22 22:29:56.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/keystone/commit/a9912b2392b1e81efcbf69e906b2a789bf2a50ee', 'message': "Request cache should not update context

The request context is kind of important. It has info like the
request cache and auth info for the request.

The request cache should not be modifying the request context. The
code here makes it look like the request cache needs to update the
thread's request context but it actually never does change it since
even if it creates a new RequestContext the new instance becomes

Change-Id: Ib824648fe7cb6b3614e03f7d2570fbbfc0c3a88d
"}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2016-11-09 16:33:20.000000000', 'files': ['keystone/common/cache/_context_cache.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/keystone/commit/6ed37d241025bf577383a92f186f0b21c09ad6c1', 'message': "Request cache should not update context

Change-Id: Ib824648fe7cb6b3614e03f7d2570fbbfc0c3a88d

commit_message:
Request cache should not update context

The request context is kind of important. It has info like the
request cache and auth info for the request.

The request cache should not be modifying the request context. The
code here makes it look like the request cache needs to update the
thread's request context but it actually never does change it since
even if it creates a new RequestContext the new instance becomes
the new thread request context.

Change-Id: Ib824648fe7cb6b3614e03f7d2570fbbfc0c3a88d
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/keystone refs/changes/42/375142/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def _set_local_cache(self, key, value): ctx = self._get_request_context() for k, v in mapping.items(): self._set_local_cache(k, v)
deleted_lines: def _set_local_cache(self, key, value, ctx=None): if not ctx: ctx = self._get_request_context() ctx.update_store() ctx = self._get_request_context() for k, v in mapping.items(): self._set_local_cache(k, v, ctx)

commit_message:
Revert "Fix /var/run for centos lxc containers"

This reverts commit 018aeb4c34f70cb244f7633923828b6ececfb1a2.

Now that this has been resolved upstream, this needs to be reverted as it's causing CentOS builds to fail.

Change-Id: I55371b7eb3c5276e4d13927544c2e1d49d487753
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible-lxc_hosts refs/changes/90/395990/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

address family to try first.

tests: Created test case that enables creating a UDPPublisher with
hostname for ipv4 and ipv6.

Closes-bug: #1616496

Change-Id: I586104fe69a03e64a0fb7572442b3175f880d80d

commit_message:
Fix checking IP version when using IPv6.

This commit fixes an issue with ceilometer incorrectly determining the
IP version to use.  Previously, it checked whether the hostname was a
valid IPv6 address, but it should be resolving first to check whether
that is a valid IP address instead.

tests: Created test case that enables creating a UDPPublisher with
hostname for ipv4 and ipv6.

Closes-bug: #1616496

Change-Id: I586104fe69a03e64a0fb7572442b3175f880d80d
Co-authored-by: Joseph Richard <Joseph.Richard@windriver.com>

commit_message:
Block kombu 4.0.0

oslo.messaging is not compatible with it, for two reasons: because we
cap amqp<2.0.0 there; and because the code of the library needs some
adjustments.

Until we clear that up, we will block the new  kombu release. We don't
cap because it's against the direction we want to take long term
(adopting to new upstream releases).

Change-Id: I34e0ca49966d679ff60d4bcfbf7157c6289a9aef
Related-Bug: #1638263
(cherry picked from commit 68d10af6e1c11c818b4419a466cb6e0b9c060a55)

commit_message:
Remove join filter from pip module tasks

Ansible 2.2 now treats the 'name' argument for the pip module
as a list, removing the need for us to implement the join
filter to optimise the install execution.

Change-Id: I5daf0a42537ca659d7c43b0aae4e0596e82398fc

commit_message:
Drop group for charm-lxd

The LXD charm uses launchpad.net/charm-lxd for bug tracking, rather
than launchpad.net/charms/+source/lxd; drop group configuration to
ensure that updates are actually made to referenced bugs.

Change-Id: I0cf154bb65fbca50461c0ad9d49047f8fd19053f

commit_message:
rally: enable panko devstack plugin for Newton+ only

The project does not have stable/mitaka branch, and it just broke
neutron gate for stable/mitaka with
I6c069de6f7a03af0a54631c87d3e467683d0ddae that relies on a function from
oslo.middleware not present in the branch.

Change-Id: I781ae2123fe42dd0470eb44c7f3901887fdba9a9
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/project-config refs/changes/81/395681/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # panko exists for Newton+ only if [[ "$ZUUL_BRANCH" != "stable/liberty" -a "$ZUUL_BRANCH" != "stable/mitaka" ]]; then export PROJECTS="openstack/panko $PROJECTS" fi # panko exists for Newton+ only if [[ "$ZUUL_BRANCH" != "stable/liberty" -a "$ZUUL_BRANCH" != "stable/mitaka" ]]; then DEVSTACK_LOCAL_CONFIG+=$'\n'"enable_plugin panko git://git.openstack.org/openstack/panko" fi # panko exists for Newton+ only if [[ "$ZUUL_BRANCH" != "stable/liberty" -a "$ZUUL_BRANCH" != "stable/mitaka" ]]; then ENABLED_SERVICES+=panko-api, fi

commit_message:
Restrict gate-tempest-dsvm-multinode-full-ubuntu-xenial to Newton

Just like with the gate-tempest-dsvm-full-ubuntu-xenial job,
the multinode variant of that nova-network job should be restricted
to stable/newton since we're going to switch devstack-gate to run
with neutron by default in master (ocata), and nova-network won't
work except in cells v1 configurations.

This just updates the regex to accont for the multinode nova-net
job in addition to the single node job.

Change-Id: Ie061c3c18a1b7ef23d6bff8bb6f705fd5ec65ca5
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/project-config refs/changes/93/395793/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Restrict nova-net grenade jobs to <= Newton

Nova is going to make nova-network fail to start except
in cells v1 configurations, so we need to restrict all
non-neutron grenade jobs to run on <= Newton stable branches.

This is mostly targeted at the jobs defined in the
grenade-nova-net group, and the -forward and -multinode
grenade jobs.

Change-Id: I62348f39b58e188b85d18918cfd302fa2d006907
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/project-config refs/changes/00/393400/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
[Floating IP] Neutron support for "ip floating create" command

This patch adds --subnet, --port, --floating-ip-address
and --fixed-ip-address options only. Project related options
will be added in another patch because it relates to identity
v2 and v3, which will make the unit tests too complicated in
one single patch.

Change-Id: I3cce4404a114ff128b74e4596f0e847be2846b17
Partial-Bug: 1519502
Related-to: blueprint neutron-client
(cherry picked from commit 860dbc132d512c6df16d29875bb6388d10d9fab8)

commit_message:
Add incompatibility info for "ip floating list" command

Commit d8abec33ada8b2b028d52eb8bfad2640812b9af8 changed
the output of "ip floating list" command. But forgot to
add any backward incompatibility info.

Output of command "ip floating list" for nova network
has been changed. And it is different from the output
of neutron network.

This patch adds this incompatibility info.

Change-Id: I45858fda3b9bcc0bdf4d0891637fa7dd712872af
Partial-Bug: 1519502
Related-to: blueprint neutron-client
(cherry picked from commit 515cc87174e1ea150c77e63bb8e17b007dde44d1)

commit_message:
Revert "Add config option to create networks with port_security_enabled"

This reverts commit 039b2fe1764e212133a652c62cb003a9f15c76b0
because it broke plugins without the extension.

The rationale in the commit message of the change is questionable:

- if we shouldn't require tempest users to maintain the extension
  list, why should we require them to maintain the new
  CONF.network_feature_enabled.port_security?

- what's "default neutron, i.e. not devstack"?  neutron itself
  doesn't have a default even for core_plugin.

Closes-Bug: #1638487
Change-Id: I8f209dff0b5ef6dcad5864ae36ae0245d612b740
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tempest refs/changes/18/393618/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
deleted_lines: # TODO(mriedem): We shouldn't actually need to check this since neutron # disables the port_security extension by default, but the problem is nova # assumes port_security_enabled=True if it's not set on the network # resource, which will mean nova may attempt to apply a security group on # a port on that network which would fail. This is really a bug in nova. @testtools.skipUnless( CONF.network_feature_enabled.port_security, 'Port security must be enabled.')

commit_message:
Fix creating tag and add metadata for tag

*Function create_tag moved to TagCollection
*Metadata copied from roles to tags

Change-Id: Iebc9b899a6954dbf9b29925aaac7ddcb8384d939
Implements: blueprint role-decomposition
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/fuel-web refs/changes/18/390818/5 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: from nailgun import errors tag_meta = instance.tags_metadata role_meta = instance.roles_metadata for role, role_data in role_meta.items(): role_tags = role_data.get('tags', []) if not role_tags: if role in tag_meta: raise errors.InvalidData('Tag {} has not assign to role') \ .format(role) tag_meta[role] = { 'tag': role, 'has_primary': role_data.get('has_primary', False), 'public_ip_required': role_data.get('public_ip_required', False), 'public_for_dvr_required': role_data.get('public_for_dvr_required', False) } role_data['tags'] = [role] role_meta.mark_dirty() missed = set(role_tags) - set(tag_meta) if missed: raise errors.InvalidData('Missed metadata for tag: {}' .format(', '.join(missed))) for name, meta in six.iteritems(tag_meta): data = { 'owner_id': instance.id, 'owner_type': consts.TAG_OWNER_TYPES.release, 'tag': name, 'has_primary': meta.get('has_primary', False), 'read_only': True } Tag.create(data)
deleted_lines: metadata = instance.tags_metadata for role, role_data in instance.roles_metadata.items(): tag_meta = metadata.get(role, {}) for tag in role_data.get('tags', []): data = { 'owner_id': instance.id, 'owner_type': 'release', 'tag': tag, 'has_primary': tag_meta.get('has_primary', False), 'read_only': True } Tag.create(data)

commit_message:
remove extra bracket from script in docs.

The troubleshooting guide has a python script in it which has invalid
syntax. This removes the extra bracket from that script and makes it
function correctly.  I also added some more specificity for credentials.

Change-Id: I9c8b8f861b4226d9eddca4ab44c811faa89160bc

added_lines: /** * (c) Copyright 2016 NEC Corporation * * Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may * not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain * a copy of the License at * * http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 * * Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software * distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT * WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the * License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations * under the License. */ (function() { 'use strict'; describe('horizon.dashboard.container-infra.clusters', function() { var magnum, controller, $scope; function fakePromise() { return { success : angular.noop, items : { id : '' } }; } $scope = { model: { newClusterSpec: { id: '' } } }; beforeEach(module('horizon.framework')); beforeEach(module('horizon.app.core.openstack-service-api')); beforeEach(module('horizon.dashboard.container-infra.clusters')); beforeEach(inject(function ($injector) { magnum = $injector.get('horizon.app.core.openstack-service-api.magnum'); controller = $injector.get('$controller'); spyOn(magnum, 'getClusterTemplates').and.callFake(fakePromise); })); function createController($scoped) { return controller('createClusterInfoController', { $scope: $scoped, magnum: magnum }); } it('should init() pass', function() { createController($scope); expect(magnum.getClusterTemplates).toHaveBeenCalled(); }); it('should changeClusterTemplate() pass', function() { createController($scope); $scope.model.newClusterSpec.cluster_template_id = '1'; $scope.changeClusterTemplate(); expect($scope.cluster_template_detail.name).toBe(''); $scope.model.newClusterSpec.cluster_template_id = ''; $scope.changeClusterTemplate(); expect($scope.cluster_template_detail.name).toBe('Choose a Cluster Template'); }); }); })();

commit_message:
Add docs and releasenotes testenv in tox

Once we add docs and releasenotes testenv, we can use "tox -e docs"
and "tox -e releasenotes" for docs and releasenotes test cases

Change-Id: I0ed03348146742c85aff911216d45bc8be3a3d0b
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-zunclient refs/changes/42/394342/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: [testenv:docs] commands = python setup.py build_sphinx [testenv:releasenotes] commands = sphinx-build -a -E -W -d releasenotes/build/doctrees -b html releasenotes/source releasenotes/build/html

commit_message:
Add etcd db driver

This commit add etcd db driver code and related
test cases for etcd database.

Note that there still some code are needed to
make etcd database backend work appropriately,
those code will be added in follow up patches.

Part of blueprint etcd-db-driver
Change-Id: Ie6b80cb2c3e51808d122241c0f55a1029b8622de
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/zun refs/changes/55/364855/32 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: from oslo_config import cfg self.assertRaises(exception.ContainerAlreadyExists, self.dbapi.destroy_container(self.context, container.id) self.dbapi.destroy_container(self.context, container.uuid) self.dbapi.destroy_container, self.context, res = self.dbapi.update_container(self.context, container.id, self.dbapi.update_container, self.context, self.dbapi.update_container, self.context, container.id, {'uuid': ''}) class SqlDbContainerTestCase(DbContainerTestCase): def setUp(self): cfg.CONF.set_override('db_type', 'sql') super(SqlDbContainerTestCase, self).setUp()
deleted_lines: self.assertRaises(exception.ResourceExists, self.dbapi.destroy_container(container.id) self.dbapi.destroy_container(container.uuid) self.dbapi.destroy_container, res = self.dbapi.update_container(container.id, self.dbapi.update_container, self.dbapi.update_container, container.id, {'uuid': ''})

commit_message:
Corrects typo "requried" in kolla_docker.py

The parameter "required=True" is mistyped as "requried=True"
in ansible/library/kolla_docker.py and tests/test_kolla_docker.py

Closes bug: 1640423

Change-Id: I64c333275b9eb3eff5b1c0fa5d550f478e68020d

commit_message:
Added MountFlags for Ubuntu in multinode guide

It was pointed out that the MountFlags=shared entry
was missing for Ubuntu in the multinode deployment guide.
The entry has been added back in.

Change-Id: I164932848eeaec3963fa205d4493a3b7f2343dfd
Closes-Bug: #1640618

commit_message:
Don't include openstack/common in flake8 exclude list

The directory openstack/common was used to keep codes from
oslo-incubator, we have retired oslo-incubator in following patch
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/297487/
so don't use this directory any more.

Change-Id: Id20b9cb8cd63e018a2f566cb12600b8f9e518665

commit_message:
Move Image driver options to conf directory

Change-Id: Ib1290852cb0b62c59809288a925a8ad42288021e
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/zun refs/changes/05/395005/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); # you may not use this file except in compliance with the License. # You may obtain a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, # WITHOUT WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or # implied. # See the License for the specific language governing permissions and # limitations under the License. from oslo_config import cfg image_driver_opts = [ cfg.ListOpt( 'image_driver_list', default=['glance.driver.GlanceDriver', 'docker.driver.DockerDriver'], help="""Defines the list of image driver to use for downloading image. Possible values: * ``docker.driver.DockerDriver`` * ``glance.driver.GlanceDriver`` Services which consume this: * ``zun-compute`` Interdependencies to other options: * None """) ] glance_driver_opts = [ cfg.StrOpt( 'images_directory', default=None, help='Shared directory where glance images located. If ' 'specified, docker will try to load the image from ' 'the shared directory by image ID.'), ] glance_opt_group = cfg.OptGroup(name='glance', title='Glance options for image management') ALL_OPTS = (glance_driver_opts + image_driver_opts) def register_opts(conf): conf.register_group(glance_opt_group) conf.register_opts(glance_driver_opts, group=glance_opt_group) conf.register_opts(image_driver_opts) def list_opts(): return {"DEFAULT": ALL_OPTS}

commit_message:
Don't pass config object to send_ip_addr_adv_notif()

Previously, the function consumed a config object and picked only a
single option send_arp_for_ha from that object. This patch replaces the
config object with count itself in order to be able to send gratuitous
ARPs not relying on a single config option.

As per http://codesearch.openstack.org, this function is not called in
any other stadium project. The send_arp_for_ha option is deprecated as
for Ocata.

Related-bug: 1639315

Change-Id: I6efc539a969bebb4fd969e1648a787bf7dc9cd0b

commit_message:
Image Pull should use image docker driver

Wth commit https://review.openstack.org/#/c/383678/ pull_image()
was moved from container docker driver to image docker driver.
So, there is no pull_image() in file: zun/container/docker/driver.py

Change-Id: Id07a53f1accbb44fce21135817a7704a20344803
Closes-Bug: 1639540

subject: Add deadlock retry to API and ML2 RPC port update
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-06-14 02:15:38.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron/commit/1b6b8055c7acb9d9ee94fe05b567155f04b92234', 'message': "Add deadlock retry to delete_subnet and IP alloc

The current IPAM allocation code uses a 'with_lockmode(update)' on
the query which can cause deadlocks when it can't get the lock or
when other things try to delete from the table while the lock is
present.

This wasn't a problem in with the old C mysql driver because IPAM
didn't make any eventlet yielding calls while holding the lock. However,
with the pymysql driver, eventlet will yield when waiting on a query
so other stuff will continue to happen while the lock is held.

This patch adds a retry decorator to the IP generation code and
to the delete_subnet method of ML2. These are the two locations
observed to cause DBDeadLock failures so far. There may be other
calls that will fail frequently as well that will have to be
decorated with retry logic.

These decorators can be removed once a lockless algorithm is picked
for IPAM, which needs to happen anyway since that lock doesn't work
on all DB backends.

Partial-Bug: #1464612
Change-Id: I635cc49ca69f589f99ab145d4d51e511b24194d2
"}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2015-06-14 22:11:19.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron/commit/885fc7ee304b59a4bf5e2738cd7751e35a3f555f', 'message': "Add deadlock retry to ML2 IP alloc interactions

The current IPAM allocation code uses a 'with_lockmode(update)' on
the query which can cause deadlocks when it can't get the lock or
when other things try to delete from the table while the lock is
present.

This wasn't a problem in with the old C mysql driver because IPAM
didn't make any eventlet-yielding calls while holding the lock. However,
with the pymysql driver, eventlet will yield when waiting on a query
so other stuff will continue to happen while the lock is held.

This patch adds a retry decorator to the main methods of ML2 that
interact with the IP allocations code (port and subnet CRUD ops).

These decorators can be removed once a lockless algorithm is picked
for IPAM, assuming that there aren't other deadlocks that the decorator
ends up catching.

These should handle the observed deadlocks related to the
ipallocations table. However, there were also some observed related
to the security groups operations, so I marked this as a partial
fix.

Partial-Bug: #1464612
Change-Id: I635cc49ca69f589f99ab145d4d51e511b24194d2
"}, {'number': 3, 'created': '2015-06-16 22:21:49.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron/commit/89fadbff9d49f6469df9926cd45b5ec861d947c0', 'message': "Add deadlock retry to ML2 IP alloc interactions

the query which can cause deadlocks when it can't get the lock or
when other things try to delete from the table while the lock is
present.

This wasn't a problem in with the old C mysql driver because IPAM
didn't make any eventlet-yielding calls while holding the lock. However,
with the pymysql driver, eventlet will yield when waiting on a query
so other stuff will continue to happen while the lock is held.

This patch adds a retry decorator to the main methods of ML2 that
interact with the IP allocations code (port and subnet CRUD ops).

These decorators can be removed once a lockless algorithm is picked
for IPAM, assuming that there aren't other deadlocks that the decorator

Partial-Bug: #1464612
Change-Id: I635cc49ca69f589f99ab145d4d51e511b24194d2
"}, {'number': 4, 'created': '2015-06-18 08:03:18.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/api/v2/base.py', 'neutron/plugins/ml2/plugin.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron/commit/4e77442d529d9803ff90de905b846af940eaf382', 'message': 'Add deadlock retry to API and ML2 RPC port update

With the switch to the pymsql SQL driver, eventlet will now yield
during database transactions. This greatly increased our probability
of multiple coroutines running transactions on the same table that
result in deadlocks.

These deadlocks could result from many things including the following:
* a coroutine holding a pessimistic "SELECT for UPDATE" lock when
  another tries to update the locked records
* two coroutines both issue update statements using a WHERE clause
  invalidated by the other update (e.g. from a compare and swap approach)
* two coroutines insert records that, when combined, violate a unique
  constraint on the table in a master-master Galera deployment
* any two workers using "SELECT for UPDATE" in a master-master Galera
  deployment (write-set certification failure translates to deadlock)

This problem is exacerbated by the switch to multiple API and RPC
workers, each of which can lead to most of the errors above even
without the switch to pymysql.

This patch adds a deadlock retry decorator to the delete, create,
and update methods at the HTTP API layer. Additionally, it adds a
decorator to the update_port_status AMQP API in ML2 since it updates
the port table, which is a heavily locked table by ML2 making it a
prime candidate for deadlocks.

Nova has had relied on the deadlock retry mechanism for quite some
time now. We were limping along by not using additional workers and
by relying on the unyielding nature of the MySQL C driver to
serialize everything.

Closes-Bug: #1464612
Change-Id: I635cc49ca69f589f99ab145d4d51e511b24194d2
'}]
commit_message:
Add deadlock retry to API and ML2 RPC port update

With the switch to the pymsql SQL driver, eventlet will now yield
during database transactions. This greatly increased our probability
of multiple coroutines running transactions on the same table that
result in deadlocks.

These deadlocks could result from many things including the following:
* a coroutine holding a pessimistic "SELECT for UPDATE" lock when
  another tries to update the locked records
* two coroutines both issue update statements using a WHERE clause
  invalidated by the other update (e.g. from a compare and swap approach)
* two coroutines insert records that, when combined, violate a unique
  constraint on the table in a master-master Galera deployment
* any two workers using "SELECT for UPDATE" in a master-master Galera
  deployment (write-set certification failure translates to deadlock)

This problem is exacerbated by the switch to multiple API and RPC
workers, each of which can lead to most of the errors above even
without the switch to pymysql.

This patch adds a deadlock retry decorator to the delete, create,
and update methods at the HTTP API layer. Additionally, it adds a
decorator to the update_port_status AMQP API in ML2 since it updates
the port table, which is a heavily locked table by ML2 making it a
prime candidate for deadlocks.

Nova has had relied on the deadlock retry mechanism for quite some
time now. We were limping along by not using additional workers and
by relying on the unyielding nature of the MySQL C driver to
serialize everything.

Closes-Bug: #1464612
Change-Id: I635cc49ca69f589f99ab145d4d51e511b24194d2

revisions:

in notified handlers not running. This can result in a

This patch changes the default behaviour to force the handlers

commit_message:
Always force handler execution

When a task fails in a playbook, the default behaviour results
in notified handlers not running. This can result in a
configuration change being executed, but the service not being
restarted.

This patch changes the default behaviour to force the handlers
to run when a playbook fails for any reason except a host being
unreachable.

Change-Id: I8a16bb1a5c04345e962ab01225f3d972781d9ed7
Reference: http://docs.ansible.com/ansible/playbooks_error_handling.html#handlers-and-failure
(cherry picked from commit 227f24f07eefea8421b805dad25305e178a83063)

commit_message:
Disable SSLv3 in the haproxy service

Add the 'ssl-default-bind-options no-sslv3' option to the
haproxy configuration file so that SSLv3 is not enabled.

Change-Id: Iad45a6b7a3ddc33b2b979234f2116ffb17da92f8
Closes-Bug: 1640560
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible refs/changes/12/395812/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: {% if haproxy_ssl | bool %} ssl-default-bind-options no-sslv3 tune.ssl.default-dh-param {{haproxy_ssl_dh_param}} {% endif %}

commit_message:
Get rid of useless tenant_id attribiute

The corresponding tenant_id will be retrieved
automatically for all neutron scenario tests
helper functions. There is no need to cache
it before.

Change-Id: I28f3f1084b91c809335494eb16219b3d9261b8bf

commit_message:
Add new nova flavor resource functionality

Add ability to associate private flavors to multiple
projects (tenants).

Change-Id: Ia6921d1dc542409928626e43a9c268568f3a9d78
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/heat-specs refs/changes/71/381171/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: .. This work is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution 3.0 Unported License. http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0/legalcode ============================================================================== Update OS::Nova::Flavor Resource Type to Support Multi-project private flavors ============================================================================== TEMPORARY: Include the URL of your launchpad blueprint: TEMPORARY: https://blueprints.launchpad.net/heat/+spec/example An administrator would like the ability to associate a flavor with multiple projects that are not the one's creating the flavor. This blueprint proposes an update to an existing resource type, nova flavor. Problem description =================== The traditional OS::Nova::Flavor allows the definition of a private flavor, but it only associates it the flavor with the project making the request. This change allows the resource type to be used by an Admin user to associate a private flavor with multiple projects that are not the one's creating the flavor. Proposed change =============== This blueprint proposes to alter an existing resource type ``OS::Nova::Flavor`` in heat to address the problem described. This will be done by taking the existing ``flavor.py`` and updating the resource type. From that file we will add ``PROJECTS`` to the list of ``PROPERTIES`` as well as its schema. The schema will look something like: .. code-block:: python PROJECTS: properties.Schema( properties.Schema.LIST, _('List of projects.'), update_allowed=True, default=None ) Implementation ============== Assignee(s) ----------- Primary assignee: * Chris Martin - cm876n Additional Assignees: * Tanvir Talukder - tanvirt Milestones ---------- Target Milestone for completion: ocata-2 Work Items ---------- * Implement changes to resource type OS::Nova::Flavor * Implement unit and functional tests * Document changes to existing resource type Dependencies ============ None

commit_message:
Restore: initialize heat client using current login tenant by default

Now the restore_target and restore_auth parameters must be specified
when calling a restore API. There two parameters could be optional.
Heat client can be initialized using current login tenant when the
restore_target and restore_auth is not provided.

Change-Id: I35a259f4af220b2971349f5e4c7d797ac83e0520

commit_message:
Use updated get_url module checksum functionality

Starting in Ansible 2.0, the get_url [1] module provides the
ability for a checksum to be provided to the get_url module
which will be verified against the local destination file
and the task skipped if it matches.

[1] http://docs.ansible.com/ansible/get_url_module.html

This patch implements the use of this functionality.

The ability to ignore a venv download failure is also removed
as this is not necessary or desirable. It is better for the
download to fail and the playbook execution to stop immediately
so that the failure point is exposed.

Change-Id: I7e81f4c7c6748c0d7dc4df6f968465f044027b6b
(cherry picked from commit 63143ee91730ef0b8241cd412f7969868124202f)

commit_message:
Switch to new hacking 0.12

The release includes its own check for delayed string interpolation for
log messages, so we can now remove our own check for the same thing. The
check is off-by-default, so we need to explicitly enable it. Sadly,
select= directive in tox.ini is broken [1] so we need to enable the
check with flake8 argument instead.

[1] https://github.com/PyCQA/pycodestyle/issues/390

Change-Id: Idc6b8e5b1cb594e130d4cc0cbcfffd362f9ab86a

commit_message:
Add object-reconstructor for swift EC

Swift Erasure Coding requires the object-reconstructor to be running,
this PR adds the object-reconstructor configuration and systemd/upstart
file.

Additionally, this PR adds testing for an erasure-coding policy as well
as for multiple policies in 1 deployment.

This is a manual re-implementation of [1] for the Mitaka branch due to
the differences in the service contiguration code between Ocata/Newton
and Mitaka.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/388819

Change-Id: I37934da8483d997dd669e0317be09596fed657e6
Closes-Bug: #1634859

commit_message:
Remove join filter from pip module tasks

Ansible 2.2 now treats the 'name' argument for the pip module
as a list, removing the need for us to implement the join
filter to optimise the install execution.

Change-Id: Ib2fa56715968daa27c0ddc45941dac996a323c03

commit_message:
Don't send confirmation notification if it's not enabled

Currently even though the 'require_confirmation' option is False,
Zaqar will send the confirmation notification anyway, which is
breaking the backward compatibility. This patch will fix it and
add a test for that.

Closes-Bug: #1633222

Change-Id: I2d6363feab90ff737684d5c1d903c2c2d7abe106
(cherry picked from commit c19d0a0153a0e63d6806616092ed234431d4599d)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/zaqar refs/changes/36/395236/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
use local type and model data for releases.openstack.org

Update the sphinx extension to pull the release model and project type
from the local deliverable file instead of the governance repository.

Change-Id: Iddc1accc52fdcc6f0fad9993ec073de325f3a4b0
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

commit_message:
move deliverable type into deliverable files

The deliverable type is really only used to control how the
releases.openstack.org website is rendered, so it does not need to be in
the governance repository. Copy the current values here to a new 'type'
field in the deliverable file and update the validator to require all
deliverable files to have values.

Change-Id: I0def1117b45170ebf451ef510917db9c20301e17
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

commit_message:
move release model into deliverable files

Because release models change from series to series, we want to track
the data in the releases repository instead of in the governance
repository. This change adds a new 'release-model' field to the
deliverable files to hold the new value.

The valid release models are documented as part of a new reference
section for the published documentation for the site.

The validator looks only at the deliverable file for the release model,
and no longer looks at the projects.yaml file in the governance
repository. For files in the _independent directory, the release model
is inferred from the filename to avoid having to set it redundantly.

Change-Id: I81198a86da98436dc2f65806aafc5f241340c57f
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

commit_message:
Remove join filter from pip module tasks

Ansible 2.2 now treats the 'name' argument for the pip module
as a list, removing the need for us to implement the join
filter to optimise the install execution.

Change-Id: I75904ca74e8626f1b0a597e6d8bfe01d00373dce
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible-os_ceilometer refs/changes/19/395819/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Remove join filter from pip module tasks

Ansible 2.2 now treats the 'name' argument for the pip module
as a list, removing the need for us to implement the join
filter to optimise the install execution.

Change-Id: I7d9b2133b9a119888a8f91544a49abb94d2bce1f
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible-os_keystone refs/changes/28/395828/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Disable gnocchi-api service when mod_wsgi is used

The *_services dict pattern present in other roles
has been adopted and systemd/upstart service enablement
of the gnocchi-api service is now directly tied to the
state of `gnocchi_use_mod_wsgi`.

Change-Id: Ibc15c37bbd5a1a70b0774a1184b5759e558a0efb
Closes-Bug: #1633205

commit_message:
comment out kolla 1.0.0

There's no 1.0.0 tag in openstack/kolla. The version was tagged
1.0.0-liberty.

Change-Id: I7e0e2a0a4d0a9e6f9ecb289b9d789cfbc0bf5db5
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>
